EthicallyChallenged, it happens that it is not the eleventh time and I do confess I fear for your deteriorating and Kool-Aid raddled brain, but for the reasonable and rational with intact brains, here are the facts:
 
 In regard to John Sydney McCain III and his team member William Timmons:
 
An aide John McCain has picked to head his presidential transition team was involved in a high-profile lobbying effort on behalf of Saddam Hussein.
 
 William Timmons worked closely with two lobbyists who were convicted of being "unregistered agents" for the Iraqi dictator, according to Sky News.
 
 Samir Vincent and Tongsun Park both tried to ease Western sanctions on Iraq following the first Gulf War.
 
 http://www.metro.co.uk/news/world/article.html?McCain_aide_has_links_to_Saddam_regime&in_article_id=357897&in_page_id=64
 
 John Sydney McCain III and G. Gordon Liddy:
 
Ayers is an extreme figure. But then again so is G. Gordon Liddy, the former White House "plumber" and Watergate burglar. On behalf of the Nixon administration he masterminded a break-in at the office of Daniel Ellsberg's psychiatrist and managed a 20-year prison sentence only because his most far-fetched schemes (including kidnapping anti-war protestors and bombing the Brookings Institution) never came to fruition. Liddy's sentence was commuted by Jimmy Carter, and since that time he's built a career as a radio host. McCain has appeared on Liddy's show and congratulated him for his "continued success and adherence to the principles and philosophies that keep our nation great." Are we supposed to hold McCain accountable for this association?

 http://www.theatlantic.com/doc/200810u/obama-ayers/2
